isis.stitle: DT-466E and 530E Diesel Engine Service (1995 through 1999) - SECTION: INTRODUCTION - FUEL INJECTOR ASSEMBLY

svcproc.title: FUEL INJECTOR ASSEMBLY
svcproc.para: The fuel injector is a unitized fuel injector that is hydraulically actuated and electronically controlled.
Hydraulic actuation is accomplished when the injector solenoid is energized opening a poppet valve and allowing ICP pressure to flow on top of the amplifier/accumulator piston.
Fuel is supplied to the injector by passages drilled through the cylinder head that intersect with fill ports in the injector.

The area under the plunger is filled with fuel from pressure supplied by the supply pump. As the plunger moves down the increased pressure closes the fuel inlet check ball. Pressure continues to rise opening the nozzle valve, fuel is pressurized thru the nozzle orifices and injected into the combustion chamber.
Injection is terminated when the solenoid is denergized and ICP pressure is released.
